title: Form - Usage Examples
description: Common usage patterns and example configurations for form container block

validationRules.block_id: Required, unique identifier for the form block
validationRules.formId: Required, unique form ID used for submission tracking
validationRules.actionOption: Required JSON array, must include at least one action (Email, MailChimp, ConvertKit, GetResponse, Slack, Webhook, Redirect, etc.)
validationRules.emailTo1: Required if action includes 'Email', admin email address
validationRules.subject1: Email subject line, can use shortcodes like [nxt_name], [nxt_email]
validationRules.frmEmail: Sender email for form submission, default '[nxt_email]'
validationRules.frmNme: Sender name for form submission, default '[nxt_name]'
validationRules.replyTo: Reply-to email address, typically '[nxt_email]' for user's email
validationRules.emailTo2: Optional second email action (auto-response to user)
validationRules.redirect.url: Required if action includes 'Redirect', thank-you page URL
validationRules.mailchmpApiki: Required if action includes 'MailChimp', MailChimp API key
validationRules.mailchmpAud: Required if action includes 'MailChimp', Audience/List ID
validationRules.ktApiKey: Required if action includes 'ConvertKit', ConvertKit API key
validationRules.convertkitformoption: Required if action includes 'ConvertKit', Form ID
validationRules.getResApiKey: Required if action includes 'GetResponse', API key
validationRules.slackTkn: Required if action includes 'Slack', Bot token (xoxb-...)
validationRules.slackChnl: Required if action includes 'Slack', Channel name (#channel-name)
validationRules.webhookurl: Required if action includes 'Webhook', endpoint URL
validationRules.reqIcn: Boolean, show required asterisk (*) after labels, default true
validationRules.showBlockContent: Boolean, controls visibility in editor, default true

warnings: NEVER modify block_id - it's the unique form identifier
actionOption MUST be valid JSON array format: [{"value": "Email", "label": "Email"}]
Email action requires emailTo1 or form won't send
MailChimp action requires both mailchmpApiki AND mailchmpAud
ConvertKit action requires both ktApiKey AND convertkitformoption
Slack action requires both slackTkn AND slackChnl
Webhook action requires valid webhookurl (must be HTTPS for production)
Redirect action requires redirect.url or will fail silently
Using [nxt_email] in frmEmail without email field will break form
Using [nxt_name] in frmNme without name field will break form
formId must be unique across entire site to prevent submission conflicts
Empty valErrMsg or failMsg creates poor UX (no user feedback on errors)
Setting inpBg='transparent' without proper container background creates invisible inputs
chkRadSz too small (<14px) creates accessibility issues on mobile
Missing innerBlocks (no form fields) creates empty non-functional form
commonMistakes: Forgetting to set openTypography: 1 before setting lblTypo, inpTypo, btnTypo values
Using actionOption as string instead of JSON array (must be [{...}] format)
Setting emailTo1 to [nxt_email] (should be admin's actual email address)
Not configuring API keys for integrations (MailChimp, ConvertKit, etc.)
Using invalid Slack token format (must start with 'xoxb-')
Not including required form fields referenced in shortcodes (e.g., [nxt_email])
Copying formId from examples without changing it (creates duplicate IDs)
Not setting reqIcn=true but marking fields as required (confusing for users)
Using same styling for all states (normal/hover/active should differ for UX)
Not testing form submissions before going live
Setting rowGap/columnGap too small on mobile (xs breakpoint needs adequate spacing)
Using gradient backgrounds for checkboxes without proper contrast
Not providing user feedback messages (autoRespMsg, valErrMsg, failMsg)
bestPractices: Always test form submissions with all configured actions before deploying
Use dual email action (emailTo1 + emailTo2) for admin notification + user auto-response
Set different hover states (hvrInpBdrClr, hvrBtnBgClr) for better UX feedback
Use active/focus states (actInpBdrClr, actInpBg) to show current field
Keep btnPad between 12-18px vertical for comfortable click targets
Set chkRadSz minimum 16px for mobile accessibility (20px recommended)
Use reqIcn=true to visually indicate required fields with asterisk
Provide helpful validation messages (valErrMsg should guide user to fix errors)
Use formAlign responsive values (center on mobile, left on desktop)
Set adequate rowGap (18-24px) and columnGap (15-20px) for breathing room
Use inpBdrRds and btnBdrRds consistently for cohesive design
Match button styling to site's primary color scheme
For integrations: store API keys securely, don't commit to version control
Use shortcodes [nxt_name], [nxt_email] in email subjects for personalization
Set replyTo='[nxt_email]' so admin can reply directly to user
Use redirect action with success pages for better conversion tracking
Style success/error messages (sucClr, sucTypo) to match site theme
Test all responsive breakpoints (md/sm/xs) for form layout

layoutContext.formContainer: tp-form-block is parent container, controls global form styling (labels, inputs, buttons, checkboxes, dropdowns)
layoutContext.childBlocks: Form fields are child blocks (nxt-name-field, nxt-email-field, nxt-message-field, nxt-phone-field, nxt-number-field, nxt-date-field, nxt-time-field, nxt-url-field, nxt-checkbox-field, nxt-radio-field, nxt-option-field, nxt-submit-button)
layoutContext.parentInheritedStyling: All child fields inherit styling from parent: lblClr, lblTypo, inpClr, inpBg, inpBdr, plcClr, etc.
layoutContext.layoutType: Controls form layout structure (nxt-style-1 default, other styles may exist for different layouts)
layoutContext.rowGap: Vertical spacing between form rows (fields stacked)
layoutContext.columnGap: Horizontal spacing when fields are side-by-side
layoutContext.formAlign: Flexbox justify-content for form alignment (flex-start=left, center, flex-end=right)
layoutContext.responsiveBehavior: All spacing, typography, sizes respect md/sm/xs breakpoints
layoutContext.stateManagement: Form handles 3 states: normal (default), hover (hvrInpBg, hvrLblClr), active/focus (actInpBg, actInpBdrClr, actPlc)
layoutContext.submissionFlow: 1. Validate → 2. Show loader (ldrClr spinner) → 3. Execute actions (Email/MailChimp/etc.) → 4. Show success (sucClr message) or error (failMsg) → 5. Redirect if configured

performanceConsiderations: Multiple action integrations (Email + MailChimp + Slack) increase submission time
Webhook actions depend on third-party API response time
Large email lists in MailChimp may have rate limits
ConvertKit/GetResponse API calls add 1-3 second delay
Slack messages are near-instant but token validation adds overhead
Auto-response emails (emailTo2) double email send time
Complex gradient backgrounds (chkdChkRadBg) may impact older browsers
Many form fields increase DOM size, limit to 15-20 fields per form
accessibilityNotes: reqIcn=true adds asterisk (*) for required fields - essential for accessibility
Labels (lblClr, lblTypo) must have sufficient contrast with background (WCAG AA: 4.5:1)
Input placeholder color (plcClr) should meet 3:1 contrast ratio with background
Checkbox/radio size (chkRadSz) minimum 16px for touch targets (WCAG 2.5.5)
Button color (btnClr) vs background (btnBgClr) must meet 4.5:1 contrast
Error messages (valErrMsg, failMsg) should be descriptive and helpful
Success messages (sucClr) should be visible to colorblind users (don't rely on color alone)
All form fields need associated labels (child blocks handle this)
Focus states (actInpBdrClr) must be clearly visible for keyboard navigation
Use semantic HTML (handled by child blocks) for screen reader compatibility
relatedBlocks: tpgb/tp-form-phone-field - Phone input with country selector (child)

mailchimp.setup: Get API key from MailChimp Account → Extras → API keys. Get Audience ID from Audience → Settings → Audience name and defaults.

convertkit.setup: API key from ConvertKit Settings → Advanced → API Secret. Form ID from Forms → Form → Settings.

getresponse.setup: API key from GetResponse Menu → Integrations & API → API.

slack.description: Send form submission to Slack channel
slack.setup: Create Slack App → OAuth & Permissions → Bot Token (xoxb-...). Channel name format: #channel-name.

webhook.description: POST form data to custom endpoint
webhook.dataFormat: JSON payload with all form field values

redirect.description: Redirect user to thank-you page after submission
redirect.behavior: Redirects immediately after successful submission (no success message shown)

useCasePatterns.description: Basic contact form with email notification
Business quote form with webhook + email
